definitions: flat geometric figure with three straight sides and three angles
small percussion instrument made of bent metal rod struck with metal stick
relationship or situation involving three people or things with complex interactions
examples: The students learned to calculate the area of a triangle
She drew a perfect equilateral triangle on the board
The percussionist struck the triangle at the climax
A silver triangle hangs from the music stand
Their friendship became a complicated triangle
The trade triangle connected three different continents

definitions: process of determining location by measuring angles from known points to calculate position
method of finding position using signals from multiple reference points or sources
strategic approach using multiple perspectives or sources to understand or manipulate situation
examples: The surveyors used triangulation to map the terrain
Triangulation helped establish precise boundary markers
GPS satellites use triangulation to pinpoint your location
Cell towers employ triangulation for emergency calls
The detective used triangulation of witness accounts
Political triangulation positioned him between two extremes

definitions: strong loyalty to one's own group leading to prejudice against outsiders or different groups
social system where people organize into tribes based on kinship and shared culture
examples: Political tribalism has divided the nation deeply
Social media often encourages tribalism between users
Anthropologists studied tribalism in traditional societies
Ancient tribalism shaped early human civilizations

definitions: great trouble, suffering, or distress experienced over period of time
examples: They endured many tribulations during the war years
Life's tribulations had made her remarkably strong

definitions: court of justice or legal body established to settle specific disputes
seat or bench where judges sit to hear cases
examples: The war crimes tribunal heard testimonies for months
An employment tribunal ruled in favor of workers
The judges took their places at the tribunal
Ancient rulers dispensed justice from stone tribunals

definitions: elected official in ancient Rome who protected ordinary citizens' interests
raised platform from which speeches are delivered to audiences
common newspaper name suggesting voice of the people
examples: The tribune defended plebeian rights against senators
Roman tribunes held considerable political power
The speaker addressed crowds from the marble tribune
Protesters gathered near the tribune in the square
She worked as reporter for the Chicago Tribune
The Tribune endorsed the reform candidate

definitions: river or stream that flows into larger river or lake
state or nation that pays tribute to more powerful ruler
examples: The Missouri River is a major tributary of the Mississippi
Small tributaries feed the lake from surrounding hills
Ancient kingdoms became tributaries of the empire
The tributary states sent annual payments of gold

definitions: payment made by one nation or ruler to another for protection
act, statement, or gift expressing respect, gratitude, or admiration
artistic work created to honor another artist or their work
examples: The conquered lands paid annual tribute in silver
Tribute kept the peace between warring kingdoms
The memorial stands as tribute to fallen soldiers
Her speech was a moving tribute to her mentor
The album features tribute songs to jazz legends
The film festival screened tributes to classic directors

definitions: very short period of time or instant
examples: The magician made the coin disappear in a trice
She solved the puzzle in a trice

definitions: large muscle at back of upper arm with three points of attachment
examples: Pushups strengthen your triceps and chest muscles
The bodybuilder flexed his impressive triceps

definitions: use of tricks or deception to achieve goals or deceive others
examples: The con artist relied on trickery to steal money
Political trickery undermined the democratic process

definitions: thin, slow stream of liquid flowing in drops or small amounts
slow, gradual movement or arrival of people, things, or information
examples: A trickle of water leaked from the faucet
The mountain trickle eventually becomes a river
News began to trickle in from remote areas
Only a trickle of customers visited the store

definitions: person who deceives or plays tricks on others
character in folklore who uses cunning to challenge authority
examples: The trickster fooled tourists with sleight of hand
Online tricksters create elaborate scams
Coyote serves as trickster in Native American tales
The trickster god Loki appears in Norse mythology

definitions: flag or banner having three colors, especially in equal stripes
examples: The French tricolor flies above government buildings
Revolutionary movements often adopted tricolor designs

definitions: flag or banner having three colors, especially in equal stripes
examples: The Indian tricolour features saffron, white, and green
Ships flew the tricolour to show their nationality

definitions: vehicle with three wheels, typically with two at back and one at front
examples: The toddler pedaled her red tricycle around the yard
Adult tricycles provide stability for older riders

definitions: spear with three prongs used for fishing or as weapon or symbol
examples: Neptune carries a golden trident in classical art
Fishermen used tridents to catch large fish

definitions: period of three years or lasting for three years
event or celebration that occurs every three years
examples: The company plans projects on a triennial basis
A triennial review evaluates long-term progress
The art triennial attracts international visitors
Cities compete to host the triennial conference

definitions: person who tries hard and perseveres despite difficulties
device or person that tests or evaluates something
examples: She's a real trier who never gives up
The coach values triers over natural talent
The quality trier checked each batch of products
Electronic triers test circuit board connections

definitions: something of little value, importance, or significance
British dessert of sponge cake soaked in alcohol layered with custard and fruit
examples: Don't worry about such trifles
The missing button was a mere trifle
Grandmother's sherry trifle appears at every holiday
The trifle bowl displayed colorful dessert layers

definitions: matters or concerns of very little importance or value
examples: Stop wasting time on trifling details
Such trifling complaints annoyed the manager

definitions: informal term for trigonometry as academic subject
examples: Students struggle with trig identities and formulas
The trig exam covered sine and cosine functions

definitions: branch of mathematics dealing with relationships between angles and sides of triangles
The engineer used trigonometry to calculate building heights
Trigonometry helps navigate ships across the ocean
examples: The engineer used trigonometry to calculate building heights
Trigonometry helps navigate ships across the ocean

definitions: informal term for tricycle or three-wheeled motorcycle
examples: The child's blue trike sat in the garage
Motorcycle trikes offer stability for touring

definitions: agreement, meeting, or relationship involving three parties or nations
examples: The trilateral trade agreement benefited all countries
Trilateral talks addressed regional security concerns

definitions: soft felt hat with narrow brim and indented crown
examples: He tipped his trilby hat to passing ladies
The detective wore a brown trilby and trench coat

definitions: rapid alternation between two adjacent musical notes
quavering or vibrating sound made by birds or in speech
examples: The soprano's trill filled the opera house
Flute players practice trills for technical skill
The canary's morning trill woke the household
She spoke with a slight trill in her voice

definitions: North American woodland plant with three leaves and three-petaled flowers
examples: White trilliums carpet the forest floor in spring
The rare painted trillium grows in shaded areas

definitions: extinct marine arthropod with segmented body that lived in Paleozoic era seas
examples: Museum displays showcase perfectly preserved trilobite fossils
Trilobites dominated ancient oceans for millions of years

definitions: group of three related novels, plays, films, or other works
examples: The author completed her fantasy trilogy last year
Film studios often plan trilogies for popular franchises

definitions: decorative material used as border or edging on clothing or furnishings
neat, orderly condition or state of good physical fitness
act of cutting small amounts to neaten appearance
examples: Gold trim adorned the formal military uniforms
She added lace trim to the curtains
The garden was kept in perfect trim
Athletes stay in trim during the season
Just a light trim around the edges please
The hedge needs its monthly trim

definitions: sailing vessel with three parallel hulls for stability and speed
examples: The racing trimaran cut through waves effortlessly
Trimarans offer more deck space than catamarans

definitions: period of three months, especially in pregnancy or academic calendar
examples: Morning sickness often occurs in the first trimester
The university operates on a trimester system

definitions: tool or device for cutting or trimming hedges, hair, or edges
person who changes opinions or behavior for personal advantage
examples: The electric trimmer made lawn edges look sharp
Barbers keep several hair trimmers for different cuts
Political trimmers switch parties for better positions
The trimmer adjusted his views to please everyone

definitions: decorative additions to clothing, furniture, or food dishes
pieces cut off when shaping or reducing something
examples: Turkey dinner came with all the traditional trimmings
Victorian dresses featured elaborate trimming
Collect grass trimmings for the compost pile
Hair trimmings covered the salon floor

definitions: group of three people or things considered as one unit
Christian doctrine of God as three persons in one divine being
examples: The executive trinity made all major decisions
This trinity of values guides our organization
Churches teach the Trinity of Father, Son, and Spirit
The Trinity remains a central Christian mystery

definitions: group or set of three people or things
musical composition for three performers or group of three musicians
examples: The trio of friends traveled Europe together
A trio of problems delayed the project
The jazz trio played at the downtown club
Beethoven composed beautiful piano trios

definitions: edible stomach lining of ruminant animals used as food
nonsense, rubbish, or worthless talk or writing
examples: The restaurant serves traditional tripe soup
Butchers sell cleaned tripe for cooking
Don't believe that tripe in the tabloids
His explanation was complete tripe

definitions: amount, number, or quantity three times as large as another
baseball hit allowing batter to reach third base
examples: Sales showed a triple increase over last year
The recipe makes triple the usual portion
The batter hit a triple to right field
His triple drove in two runs

definitions: one of three children born at same birth to same mother
group or set of three similar things occurring together
examples: The triplets celebrated their fifth birthday together
Raising triplets requires tremendous energy and patience
The poem features triplets of rhyming lines
Musical triplets create interesting rhythmic patterns

definitions: act or process of multiplying by three or becoming three times larger
examples: The tripling of prices shocked consumers nationwide
Population tripling strained city resources significantly

definitions: stand with three legs used to support camera, telescope, or other equipment
examples: The photographer adjusted her camera on the tripod
A sturdy tripod prevents blurry telescope images

definitions: fine powder made from weathered limestone used for polishing and grinding
examples: Jewelers use tripoli to polish silver pieces
The craftsman applied tripoli for final finishing

definitions: person taking short pleasure trip or excursion
mechanical device that trips or releases mechanism
examples: Day trippers crowded the beach on weekends
Tour buses brought trippers to the castle
The safety tripper stops the machine automatically
Adjust the tripper mechanism for proper timing

definitions: picture or carving on three panels, typically hinged together side by side
examples: The medieval triptych depicts scenes from saints' lives
Modern artists create abstract triptychs for galleries

definitions: Greek sea god depicted as merman with trident and conch shell
large marine snail with spiral shell used as trumpet
examples: Ancient mosaics show Triton blowing his conch horn
Triton served as messenger for his father Poseidon
Collectors prize the beautiful triton shells
Pacific islands used triton shells for ceremonies

definitions: great victory or achievement, especially after difficult struggle
feeling of great satisfaction or joy resulting from success
examples: The team's championship was their greatest triumph
Scientific triumphs have transformed modern medicine
She felt triumph after passing the bar exam
His face showed triumph as he crossed the finish line

definitions: group of three people sharing power, authority, or influence equally
examples: The Roman triumvirate divided control of the empire
A corporate triumvirate now leads the company
